title: The "Victorious" Cast's Tweets Celebrating the Show's 7th Anniversary Will Make You Fall Apart - Seventeen Magazine
text:
The "Victorious" Cast's Tweets Celebrating the Show's 7th Anniversary Will Make You Fall Apart 
Ariana Grande, Victoria Justice, and more reminisced about the series. Most Popular By Hannah Orenstein Mar 29, 2017 It's hard to believe that it's been seven years since Victorious 's Tori Vega had her first day at Hollywood Arts High School on March 27, 2010. But when you realize that Ariana Grande has morphed from redheaded Cat Valentine into the ponytail-swinging pop princess she is today, it suddenly becomes clearer: OMG — that was seven whole years ago. In honor of the show's anniversary, the cast took to Twitter to reminisce and thank their fans. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Ariana tweeted that she actually missed bibble, the colorful popcorn snack that Cat got hooked on in season two. 7 years of Victorious!! I genuinely miss bibble. 
— Ariana Grande (@ArianaGrande) March 27, 2017 Most Popular Victoria Justice took a deep dive into fans' #7YearsOfVictorious tweets. Wow I cannot believe it’s been 7 years  Feeling so nostalgic seeing all your #7YearsOfVictorious posts, thank you guys for the love❣️ 
— Victoria Justice (@VictoriaJustice) March 27, 2017 Daniella Monet shared her favorite old photos from the show. Went a tangent looking through old #Victorious moments. What a time. #7YearsOfVictorious pic.twitter.com/TDSdwsT5O1 
— Daniella Monet (@DaniellaMonet) March 28, 2017 And series creator Dan Schneider shared possibly the best photo of them all (need those candy PJs ASAP). WOW! So thankful that we still have the BEST FANS in the world! You all are so amazing  #7YearsOfVictorious pic.twitter.com/pBiZHOuSij 
— Dan Schneider (@DanWarp) March 27, 2017 Take a sec to relive this iconic theme song. You still know all the words, right? Hannah Orenstein is the assistant features editor at Seventeen.com. Follow her on Twitter and Instagram ! More from Seventeen:
